books.title: Poetry
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of poems by Oscar Wilde.

books.title: The Defiant Agents
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: Rival colonies are stranded on an alien world, their memories mixed with those of their ancestors and pitted against each other by the Western and Soviet forces who sent them.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Coral Island
books.author: R. M. Ballantyne
books.summary: Three shipwrecked youths encounter delights and dangers as they attempt to escape their uninhabited tropical island paradise.

books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: The Merry Wives of Windsor
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Sir John Falstaff runs astray of the denizens of Windsor by trying to seduce several local wives at once.

books.title: Domnei
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: The tale of to what extent a woman’s love is worth pursuing.

books.title: The Benson Murder Case
books.author: S. S. Van Dine
books.summary: A Manhattanite art connoisseur becomes an amateur detective as he assists his good friend, the District Attorney, in solving an unusual murder case.

books.title: The Turn of the Screw
books.author: Henry James
books.summary: A governess moves in to a haunted manor.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Lerouge Case
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A widow is found dead under mysterious circumstances, and Monsieur Lecoq of the police arranges to have his mentor brought in to help solve the crime.

books.title: A Yankee in the Trenches
books.author: Robert Derby Holmes
books.summary: An American describes his experiences in the British Army in the First World War.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: North of Boston
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: A collection of Frost’s poetry.

books.title: Martin Eden
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A young working-class man sets out to become a bourgeois writer.

books.title: The Inheritors
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A young writer dabbling in journalism meets a strange, otherworldly woman with long-term political goals.

books.title: Allan Quatermain Stories
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A collection of short stories about a legendary hunter.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
